<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_io_block_write:
```c
int metal_io_block_write(struct metal_io_region *io, unsigned long offset,
	       const void *restrict src, int len)
{
	unsigned char *ptr = metal_io_virt(io, offset);
	const unsigned char *source = src;
	int retlen;

	if (!ptr)
		return -ERANGE;
	if ((offset + len) > io->size)
		len = io->size - offset;
	retlen = len;
	if (io->ops.block_write) {
		retlen = (*io->ops.block_write)(
			io, offset, src, memory_order_seq_cst, len);
	} else {
		while ( len && (
			((uintptr_t)ptr % sizeof(int)) ||
			((uintptr_t)source % sizeof(int)))) {
			*(unsigned char *)ptr =
				*(const unsigned char *)source;
			ptr++;
			source++;
			len--;
		}
		for (; len >= (int)sizeof(int); ptr += sizeof(int),
					source += sizeof(int),
					len -= sizeof(int))
			*(unsigned int *)ptr = *(const unsigned int *)source;
		for (; len != 0; ptr++, source++, len--)
			*(unsigned char *)ptr =
				*(const unsigned char *)source;
		atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_seq_cst);
	}
	return retlen;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I did not mark other expressions because they are clearly non‑invariant runtime checks: the null-pointer test (if (!ptr)), the bounds adjustment (if ((offset + len) > io->size) ...), the block_write selection (if (io->ops.block_write)), and the return/atomic fence statements do not have controlling expressions that are constant. There are no do-while constructs in the function. The three loop headers listed above are the only controlling expressions in iteration statements and therefore are the relevant fragments to investigate under MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3.
